question.questionText: Look at the 2 pictures of drops on a flat, waterproof surface. The drop on the left is soapy water and the drop on the right is plain water. What causes the plain water to look like it does?

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: Surface tension causes the plain water to look like a bead.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: The plain water looks like it does because plain water is supposed to turn into a dome when it is on a flat surface.
The plain water can stick together much better because nothing is breaking it up.
It causes it to look like that because it has no soap in it and soap makes water flat.
The plain looks like that because of water surface tension.
It is called a dome and it forms a round like in the water.
